channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: "We risk our lives going to the grocery store," said a black protester who added she thinks the entire US criminal justice system needs to be overhauled.
item.title: Protests spread to several US cities, force White House into lockdown

item.dc:creator: Megan Levy
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases pass 5.9 million as Australian death toll stands at 103

item.description: As of Saturday, there are only six active cases in the state, but authorities remain baffled by the source of the infection that claimed the life of a 30-year-old Blackwater man.
item.title: Zero new COVID-19 cases in Queensland as Blackwater sewage tested

item.dc:creator: Lia Timson
item.description: The two countries with the worst coronavirus infection numbers also have leaders who were reluctant to take the crisis seriously but quick to hawk risky anti-malarials.
item.title: Death toll mounts as Bolsonaro's favourite drug divides nation

item.description: Visitors arriving from a group of 29 approved countries could be subject to sample coronavirus testing, the Tourism Ministry said.
item.title: Greece invites Australia and NZ to join travel bubble

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: In recent years indie bookshops have thrived where once chains failed, through personal service: but it was intimacy placed at at risk when the pandemic hit.
item.title: Adapt or perish: How indie bookshops thrived amid Australia's shutdown

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: West Australian football fans will have something to cheer about finally when the AFL releases its television schedule for the quartet of rounds that restart season 2020.
item.title: Live and loud: Eagles, Dockers fans get free-to-air win from AFL

item.description: The APL England has also been ordered to pay $22 million in clean-up costs before the ship will be released from the Port of Brisbane.
item.title: Master of the APL England cargo ship charged over container spill

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: Drew Pavlou, a student activist highly critical of the University of Queensland's ties to Beijing, has been handed a two-year suspension from the institution.
item.title: University of Queensland activist suspended for two years

item.description: Child custody arrangements have been thrown into disarray by the pandemic. Three sets of parents share how they are coping with these challenges.
item.title: Juggling social distancing when your kids are divided between two households

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: The US President said the WHO had essentially become a puppet organisation of China, and announced he was terminating the US relationship with the body.
item.title: Trump to terminate US relationship with World Health Organisation over coronavirus

item.description: I haven’t ticked the life boxes so many believe are vital to fulfilment, such as marriage and kids. But I refuse to flagellate myself with regret.
item.title: Shining a light on my shame was like turning to face a menacing shadow

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: A Minneapolis police officer who pinned an unarmed black man with a knee to the throat before the man died has been arrested and charged with murder.
item.title: Minneapolis police officer charged with murder of George Floyd

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Labor is pressing the government to open its first home loan deposit scheme to all eligible people building a new home to help the struggling sector.
item.title: Labor calls to lift cap on home-loan deposit scheme to help construction

item.description: During the arrest the anchor can be heard saying, "If you're just tuning in, you are watching our correspondent being arrested".
item.title: CNN reporter arrested live on air by Minnesota police, released an hour later

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 30, 2020

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Saturday’s group 3 TAB Fred Best Classic at Doomben shapes as a last-ditch effort for a number of three-year-olds looking to get into next week’s group 1 Stradbroke Handicap.
item.title: Inside Running: Colt chases passage into Stradbroke

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: Australians have been barred from taking a peek at correspondence between our two highest office holders on a matter of vital importance.
item.title: Why did we have to fight so hard to see the 'Palace Letters'? They weren't stashed in the Queen's bottom drawer

item.dc:creator: Dominic Perrottet
item.description: Public sector pay rises in the middle of a global pandemic do not benefit the 8 million people of NSW, many of whom are suffering right now.
item.title: We must create more jobs, not give extra money to public servants

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: Almost 200 Holden dealers are facing a David and Goliath battle with General Motors after the US car giant announced it was abandoning the Australian market.
item.title: Holden dealers on crash course with GM over payouts

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: Although Treasury expects a huge drop in GDP for the first half of the year, officials are now a little more optimistic about the prospects for the remainder of 2020.
item.title: Bean counters believe nation can dodge depression, but no sharp rebound

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: There is a disconnect between how Melbourne and Canberra understand the signature foreign and economic policy of Chinese President Xi Jinping.
item.title: Andrews cops a belting but keeps his eyes on the road

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic put sport flat on its back. As it starts to climb back to its feet, it will have a very different look and feel.
item.title: Shifting the goalposts: our new sporting life

item.dc:creator: Tony Wright
item.description: A double murder from a century ago reminds us that in the high fastness of Victoria's mountain country, some mysteries are never solved.
item.title: The secrets haunting the Wonnangatta Valley

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The Murray-Darling Basin rivers are running again after some of the best rain in years, but deep fault lines with the $13bn plan remain just below the surface.
item.title: Welcome rains boost Basin's fortunes but water wars are far from over

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Community sporting clubs in NSW are allowed to train again - but many are still wading through reams of onerous guidelines and requirements before they actually can.
item.title: 'We volunteer because we love it': hard yards behind community sport's return

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Independently-run schools are the fastest-growing sector in NSW, thanks in part to a boom in Islamic colleges.
item.title: Independent schools to overtake Catholic system as second-biggest sector in NSW

item.dc:creator: Sherryn Groch
item.description: How long is this pandemic expected to go on? Is a second wave likely? And how will we know if it is safe to reopen offices and catch public transport again?
item.title: Second wave, ripples or flare-ups – what next for the pandemic?

item.dc:creator: Ella Archibald-Binge
item.description: The Sydney Opera House has unveiled a line-up of First Nations artists to mark Reconciliation Week.
item.title: First Nations in the house for Reconciliation Week

item.dc:creator: Deborah Snow
item.description: Three years after the signing of the historic Uluru declaration, a fresh push to revive its political momentum is underway.
item.title: Keeping hope alive: the push to revive the Statement from the Heart

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: The Treasuer told the Herald the economic damage done by the coronavirus crisis meant "every dollar" of new government spending would now be targeted at lifting employment.
item.title: Perrottet's plan to boost jobs fuelled by borrowing and asset recycling

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: Nine boss Hugh Marks provides an insight into one of the most turbulent sports rights negotiations in the country's history.
item.title: 'There was this superior attitude': Nine boss lifts lid on NRL negotiations

item.dc:creator: Roy Masters
item.description: Peter V’landys' definition of a “good deal” is one where broadcasters paid more than he expected, even before COVID-19 shut down sport for more than two months.
item.title: Less money but no losers: Why a stripped-back NRL TV deal left everyone happy

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: The NRL has kept an ace up its sleeve as it prepares to return to the negotiation table with Nine in the next 18 months.
item.title: NRL keeps Origin, grand final exclusivity up sleeve for next TV deal

item.dc:creator: George Megalogenis
item.description: History shows that national unity only lasts as long as the emergency.
item.title: Lead and we follow: country of over-achievers in times of crisis

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: With an election looming, keeping Queensland's border closed is a political risk for Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk.
item.title: ‘The political dilemma’: Queensland’s border war ignites early election talk

item.description: Australians have a right to know what happened in 1975 and to know what happens in our name today.
item.title: High Court victory puts keepers of secrets on notice

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: The federal government has rejected at least one direct plea from Virgin Australia's administrator Deloitte for emergency funding, raising concerns it might fall into liquidation before new owners are found.
item.title: Deloitte's call for Virgin emergency cash rejected as liquidity fears rise

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Saturday, May 30

item.description: Any halt to pubic sector pay rises in NSW needs to be short-lived, and the way to recovery must account for the glaring gender pay gap.
item.title: If we must have a pay freeze, spare front-line jobs dominated by underpaid women

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Vacancy in city fringe office markets is expected to almost double by the end of next year.
item.title: Reality check for hot city fringe office markets

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Listed pub group Redcape says its primed to reopen its doors on Monday, with new-look properties and changes to how it serves customers in the post-pandemic era.
item.title: Redcape Hotel to reopen pubs as restrictions taper off

item.dc:creator: Paola Totaro
item.description: White-hot, palpable fury has spanned the political divide.
item.title: They made a mockery of our trust: why Britain is united in fury at the PM and his adviser

item.dc:creator: Nicole Lindsay
item.description: The Zappelli family, owners of the under-liquidation Dimmeys discount retail chain, is selling a 3885 square metre landholding in Brunswick worth around $15 million.
item.title: Third time lucky for discount king Dimmeys

item.description: The idea of moving the Powerhouse Museum to Parramatta was always a bad idea.
item.title: Premier, prove you're a powerhouse and stop it

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Rents are being cut in half in a new office development just south of Sydney's CBD.
item.title: Developer offers tenants half-price rent at prime site

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Farrelly
item.description: Our universities are addicted to their enormous cash flows – even as they casualise teaching and allow the creative mind to become dispensable.
item.title: The decline of universities, where students are customers and academics itinerant workers

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Melbourne-based Newmark Capital has started the ball rolling in post COVID-19 retail property deals.
item.title: Newmark Capital tipped as buyer of $120m David Jones store

item.description: The Magdalen Laundry at the Abbotsford Convent is layered in history.
item.title: Abbotsford Convent's historic laundry restored
